Literature Review: China's financial system has been a crucial component of its economic growth over the past four decades. The recent literature on China's financial system has shifted its focus from state-owned enterprise reform to more market-based financing channels, including shadow banking. These channels have become integral to the Aggregate Financing to the Real Economy (AFRE) measure, which accounts for the nation's yearly flow of liquidity. This review aims to synthesize the existing literature on China's financial system, its connections to the Chinese economy, and the mechanisms behind the growth of shadow banking and other market-based financing channels.
